alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 5:10AM PST until March 11 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Eureka CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Russian River near Hopland affecting Mendocino County. For the Russian River...including Hopland...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Russian River near Hopland. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding of Highway 175 is expected at the approaches to the Russian River bridge. Expect flooding of cropland on the right bank of river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM PST Thursday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 8.6 feet this afternoon. It will then rise above flood stage late tonight to 15.3 feet late tomorrow morning. It will fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 9.4 feet Saturday afternoon. It will then rise to 11.5 feet Sunday evening. It will fall to 11.3 feet early Monday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.6 feet on 03/28/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/eka. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 515 PM PST.
